primevc.gui.layout.ILayoutClient

type
interface
implements
primevc.core.traits.IDisposable
primevc.core.traits.IQueueingInvalidatable
ILayoutClient is the most basic layouttype there is. It contains the size and position of the layout-target.

Instance Variables

aspectRatio(default,null) : Float

changed(default,null) : primevc.core.dispatcher.Signal1<Int>

Signal that is send when the layout is validated and the changes involve the x, y, width or height. Be aware that even though a displayobject is off the stage, the layout can still be validated by it's layout-container when the containers displayobject is still on the stage.

changes(default,null) : Int

Flags of properties that are changed

hasValidatedHeight(default,null) : Bool

hasValidatedWidth(default,null) : Bool

height(getHeight,setHeight) : Int

Width of the LayoutClient. Changing the width will also change the height property in 'bounds'.

heightValidator(default,setHeightValidator) : primevc.core.validators.IntRangeValidator

includeInLayout(default,setIncludeInLayout) : Bool

Flag indicating if this client should be included within the layout

innerBounds(default,null) : primevc.core.geom.IntRectangle

Size of the layouclient including the padding but without the margin

maintainAspectRatio(default,setMaintainAspectRatio) : Bool

margin(default,setMargin) : primevc.core.geom.Box

outerBounds(default,null) : primevc.core.geom.IntRectangle

Size of the layouclient including the padding and margin

padding(default,setPadding) : primevc.core.geom.Box

Padding is the distance between the content of the layout and the rest of the elements. The property contains 4 values to define the padding for each side of the layout. The x and y properties contain the position of the content, the properties bottom and right contain the position including the padding. For example. Layout: - width: 400 - height: 300 - x: 50 - y 60 - padding { 10, 10, 10, 10 } The left, right, top and bottom properties of the bounds should then be: - left: 50 - top: 60 - right: 470 (400 + 50 + 20) - bottom: 380 (300 + 60 + 20)

parent(default,setParent) : ILayoutContainer

Layout-group to which this client belongs. By setting this property, the client can let the parent know when it's size or position has changed wich could result in revalidating the parents layout.

percentHeight(default,setPercentHeight) : Float

If percent height is set, the height of the layoutclient will be calculated by the height of the parent layoutContainer. This property also allow an object to fill up the available space by setting the property to LayoutFlags.FILL. The height of the percentHeight will be calculated when the layoutclient is measured.

percentWidth(default,setPercentWidth) : Float

If percent width is set, the width of the layoutclient will be calculated by the width of the parent layoutContainer. This property also allow an object to fill up the available space by setting the property to LayoutFlags.FILL. The width of the percentWidth will be calculated when the layoutclient is measured.

relative(default,setRelative) : RelativeLayout

rules for sizing / positioning the layout with relation to the parent

state(default,null) : primevc.core.states.SimpleStateMachine<primevc.gui.states.ValidateStates>

width(getWidth,setWidth) : Int

Width of the LayoutClient. Changing the width will also change the width property in 'bounds'.

widthValidator(default,setWidthValidator) : primevc.core.validators.IntRangeValidator

x(default,setX) : Int

y(default,setY) : Int

Instance Methods

getHorPosition() : Int

see
primevc.gui.layout.VirtualLayoutContainer
Method will return the x coordinate that a DisplayObject can use to positionate itself. The method will check if the clients parent is a VirtualLayoutContainer. If that's true, it will at the parent's position to the returned x coordinate. This method will not affect the x property of the client itself.

getVerPosition() : Int

see
primevc.gui.layout.VirtualLayoutContainer
Method will return the y coordinate that a DisplayObject can use to positionate itself. The method will check if the clients parent is a VirtualLayoutContainer. If that's true, it will at the parent's position to the returned y coordinates. This method will not affect the y property of the client itself.

hasMaxHeight() : Bool

hasMaxWidth() : Bool

invalidate(change : Int) : Void

This method is called when a property of a layoutclient is changed which would cause the layout the validate again.

isInvalidated() : Bool

isValidating() : Bool

validate() : Void

Validate is called before the layout is validated. In validate, each layout-object has a change to correct it's bounding-properties or measured size. Validate is called when a layoutClient is invalidated and the movie has entered a new frame.

validateHorizontal() : Void

validateVertical() : Void

validated() : Void

Method is called when a layout has run validate and is done with changing it's properties.
